A1. Crew Quarters

Sirens blare around you. You open your eyes as your head throbs with pain. A trickle of blood runs down the left side of your face. Despite the pain radiating throughout your body, you stand up to assess the damage. Aside from a few objects scattered on the floor, your quarters appear to be fine. The ships is no longer moving, but the immediate cause is unknown. 

You could either check the engine room to look for a fault, or head to the cockpit to ask Captain Tate for a report.

What's your next move?

1. I should check for damage in the engineering bay.
2. I'll head to the cockpit for a damage report.

A2. Corridor E-1

You've decided the best course of action is to search for a mechanical fault. As you walk down Corridor E-1, you notice it is unusually silent; on any given day, this hall is bustling with crew activity. Alarmed, you look around and notice a haze settling in the hallway, the source of which appears to be coming from the entrance to the engine room. 

What do you want to do?

1. I'll reach into my pack for my respirator and see what the trouble is.
2. This is a bad idea, I'm no engineer. I'm heading to the cockpit.

A3. Crew Hall 4

Captain Tate will know why the ship stopped. You exit your quarters and make your way into Crew Hall 4. As the door slides shut behind you, your breath catches in your chest as you see the bodies of Corporal Mainville, Lieutenant Hagen, and Staff Sergeant Getz on the floor. 

Getz takes in a deep, rasping breath and struggles to call your name. 

You rush across the hall to her, stumbling over Mainville's outstretched arm.

1. "Getz, it's me! Are you okay?"

X2. It's a Trap!

As you attempt to remove the canister from the ventilation system, you hear a click followed by a rapid, high-pitched beeping sound. You take a step back, but it's too late. The control panel explodes and turns the engineering bay (and you) into star dust.

Would you like to try again?

1. Yes. (Return to title screen.)
2. No. (Quit.)

S1. Escape

You enter the escape pod with Mazzone and punch in the coordinates to the nearest civilized system. As you settle into the escape pod, Mazzone shares recent rumors of betrayal within the Empire's armies; evidently, mutinies such as this have been happening fairly frequently within the Imperial Navy. Mazzone believes a Federation sympathizer sabotaged the ship in order to swing the war in the Federation's favor. 

Despite escaping the ship, you fear for the future of the Empire.

1. Return to main menu.
2. Exit the game.

A4. Inside Job

"Do I look okay?" Getz struggles to say. Her chest is vibrating with every word. "I doubt I have long so shut up and listen." 

She coughs violently and you notice blood slowly dribbling from the left side of her mouth.

"This wasn't an accident. We're being attacked from within the ship. Mainville noticed a thick gas pouring from the vents shortly before we made impact. I think someone is poisoning us."

How should you reply?

1. "That doesn't make sense, we'd know if this was an attack from within."
2. "A thick gas? Are you sure it wasn't just smoke from the impact?"

B1. Engineering Bay

Donning your respirator, you press forward into engineering. A thick, orange fog surrounds you, obstructing your immediate surroundings; however, you hear a loud beeping sound to your left.

What's your next move, boss?

1. I need to follow the beep. That will lead me to the problem.
2. Seriously, I'm not an engineer. I'm ignoring the beep and looking for help.

B2. The Sabotaged Valve

As you press forward through the fog, you see a small control panel with a blinking red light. Though your area of expertise is medical, you immediately recognize that something is amiss. Attached to the control panel is a small canister leading down into the ship's ventilation system. This explains the orange haze surrounding the engineering bay.

Now what?

1. I need to go see if anyone else on the ship is alive before I touch this.
2. I have to remove the canister from the ventilation system to prevent any further casualties.

B3. Searching for Help

With no knowledge of how to repair any potential damage to the ship, you decide to press forward and search for help. You could either head through Crew Hall 4 and make your way to the cockpit to speak to Captain Tate, or head into the Mess Hall to search for survivors.

Where do you want to head next?

1. Captain Tate would have seen whatever we hit. I should go to the cockpit.
2. I need to make sure the crew is okay. I'll head to the Mess Hall and find survivors.

B5. Mess Hall

You sprint through Corridor E-1, past Crew Hall 4, and rush into the Mess Hall. You quickly scan your surroundings and make note that the room is far too quiet. You see no one--neither living nor dead--in the hall. You slowly make your way through the Mess Hall, mindful of each step you take. As you press forward, you hear a tapping to the right and hear someone whisper your name.

You quickly turn to your right to find Chief Engineer Mazzone huddled behind a storage unit.

1. "Mazzone?! Glad to see you're alive! What the hell is going on here?"

B6. Internal Assault

"Keep it down, you fool!" Mazzone whispers in a harsh tone. "Get over here, quick. And stay down, dammit!" 

You crouch down and make your way across the Mess Hall to the storage unit where Mazzone is hiding.

"This was no accident; we've been attacked from within. I don't know who the hell did it, but we ain't safe here. If you can keep your damn wits about you and follow my orders, I can get us out of here. It ain't safe here, though. You in?"

What do you want to do?

1. "An internal attack? Are you sure? Okay, let's move, we can talk on the run."
2. "Who would attack the ship? I can't leave without knowing who's behind this."

B7. On the Run

"Okay, then. Keep your head down, and stick close. If we're spotted, we're dead."

Mazzone signals for you to follow closely behind her as she heads out of the Mess Hall toward the Promenade Deck.

"We gotta pray they haven't launched the escape pods to trap us here. Keep your eyes peeled and signal if you see anyone else on the deck."

You look around and notice one of the escape pods is still in place. You signal to Mazzone, who quickly runs over to you.

"Nice work, kid. Let's get out of here so we can send a distress signal. I don't wanna risk sticking around any longer than we have to."

1. "Okay, let's go. We can report this as soon as we can make contact with Admiral LaRoche." (Enter the escape pod.)

B8. Finding the Truth

"Suit yourself, but I ain't sticking around long enough to risk gettin' killed," Mazzone says. "You want answers? Then head to the cockpit; fastest way is to head back where you came, cut through Corridor E-1, and get back to Crew Hall 4. But listen to me and listen good: don't trust a damn soul on this ship, you hear me? The Federation has spies everywhere, and this crew ain't an exception. You sure you don't want to come with me?"

What's the plan?

1. "Thanks, Mazzone. I'll be careful. If someone doesn't find out who is sabotaging us, then the Empire may never be safe. I have to go to the cockpit."
2. "On second thought, you're right. This is too dangerous. Let's get out of here, and fast."

B4. Crew Hall 4

As you leave Corridor E-1, you stop dead in your tracks. Crew Hall 4 looks like the site of a massacre. On the floor lay the bodies of Corporal Mainville, Lieutenant Hagen, and Staff Sergeant Getz. As you scan the wreckage, you notice Getz is still breathing. You scramble across the hall and drop to one knee next to her.

1. "Getz, thank God you're alive! Are you okay? What happened in here?"

A5. Betrayal

"This was an attack, I know what smoke looks like and that wasn't smoke." She coughs more violently than before.

"Wait...how did you survive with nothing more than a scrape on your head? It...it was you, wasn't it? You're the one who sabotaged the ship! You're the Federation defector, aren't you?!"

She reaches to her hip and grips her pistol with what little strength she has and levels it toward your chest.

"I always knew something was off about you."

How do you proceed?

1. I should rush at her and tear the pistol from her grip. I can overpower her now.
2. I'll roll to my right and try to get behind some cover.

A6. Temporary Safety

You roll to the right and hide in the doorway to Mainville's quarters as Getz's blaster bolt misses wide. Sweat drips down the side of your face as Getz calls back to you.

"Why'd you do it, traitor? What was your plan?" 

Another blaster bolt misses the mark, though not by much.

1. "It wasn't me, Getz! I was in my quarters and woke up after impact!"

A7. On the Move

The blaster fire stops temporarily. Gets exhales a loud, ragged breath before she drops her pistol. You step out from the doorway and return to her side.

"Sorry...just...wanted answers," Getz struggles to say. "I...didn't think it *cough* could really...really be you, but...needed *cough* to be sure."

You lay your hand under her head and look into her eyes as they begin to glaze over. You hold her close to you as she takes in another painful breath.

"Cockpit. Get to *cough* the cockpit. Find...truth...get off...get off this...wreck."

Getz lets out a final breath before going limp in your arms. You reach down for Getz's discarded blaster, stand up, and face the doorway to the cockpit.

1. It's time to find out the truth of all this. I'm entering the cockpit.

A8. The Cockpit

The door to the cockpit opens with a hiss of compressed air. You lift Getz's blaster and hold it cautiously in front of you before you slowly step inside. Checking the room, you are surprised to see that no one is in here; however, you notice a small, blinking device attached to the ship's main control panel. You approach it cautiously before you hear a voice behind you.

"I wouldn't touch that if I were you," Captain Tate snickers. "Unless you want bits of this ship scattered around this backwater system. What's wrong? You look...confused."

Despite the rage boiling inside you, how do you respond?

1. I raise my blaster and press for answers. "Confused isn't the word. I'm furious, mostly. I just need to know why you did it."
2. I raise my blaster and back up to the control panel. "I don't give a damn what happens to this ship, so long as this ends now."

A9. The Truth

"Why did I do it?" Tate looks at you with pure disdain. "You don't truly know what Imperial rule looks like, do you? You've lived the life of a military child your entire life, protected by your heritage. I grew up on a small, relatively insignificant world, long before the Empire spread its 'influence' across the system. I watched villages...my friends...family...burn to the ground before I was forced into conscription as a child. And why? Because we wanted to continue to live a normal life? You know nothing of what the Empire is truly capable of. I will gladly die aboard this ship knowing I may have saved just one community like mine. Do what you want to me; I've already lost everything."

What should you do next?

1. I raise my blaster and press for answers. "Confused isn't the word. I'm furious, and disappointed. I just need to know why you did it."
2. I raise my blaster and back up to the control panel. "I don't give a damn what happens to this ship, so long as this ends now."

A10. Showdown

"Do you think I care?" Captain Tate laughs. "I knew this was a suicide mission from the beginning. Survival was never my endgame. So long as I can take down just one ship without risking a Federation cruiser, I've already achieved my goal. So go ahead, shoot me. Go attempt to hack into that control panel. None of it matters; you've already failed."

What now?

1. "You know what? I'll take my chances." Shoot Tate in the chest and attempt to disarm the device on the control panel.
2. "If you expected this to be a suicide mission, then you've failed. You can answer to the Emperor himself." Shoot Tate in the leg and restrain him.

X1. Too Slow

Despite her weakened state, Getz hasn't lost a step with her blaster. As you rush toward her, Getz fires and lands a direct hit on your chest. You collapse to the ground as Getz takes aim to finish the job.

"I couldn't let you take any more lives, traitor."

With a gasping breath, you utter your final words...

1. "It...wasn't...me...loyal...to...empire...until...the...end..." (Start over.)
2. "Too bad...took you so...long to...figure me out...scum..." (Start over.)

X2. Flaming Revelation

You fire the blaster and land a hit directly on Tate's chest. You watch him crumple to the ground before rushing to the control panel. Unsure of what to press, you attempt to cut the wires attaching the unit to the main controls. As you cut, you hear a loud beep coming from the unit. The ship begins to rumble as warning lights and sirens go off around you. You look down at Tate in contempt as the fire spreading throughout the ship engulfs the cockpit.

1. Return to main menu.
2. Exit the game.
